p: Herbal brews are characterised by the presence of volatile components that impart a characteristic flavour to, for example, herbal brews. The content of volatile substances has an effect on the health-promoting value of such brews and, hence, the importance of the content of that group of compounds in brews. In addition, the aroma of, for instance, tea brews, affects a number of sensory properties. At present, we have knowledge on the effect of certain flavours on the operation of the brain, on the complex hormonal system, appearance of associations, on emotions, and thus on human behaviour [ 10].
